subtitle: Stewed shin of veal - traditionally served as a meal on its own or with a risotto. This is quite an expensive dish to make but great for entertaining.

method.text: Melt the oil and butter in a large frying pan. Add the crushed garlic and then the onion and carrot. Fry together for 5 min or until softened.
Toss the veal chunks in the flour until lightly coated. Add the veal to the pan and fry for 5 min on each side or until well browned. Transfer to an ovenproof dish with the vegetables.
Reduce the heat. Slowly stir the wine into the frying pan until all is incorporated, making a sauce. Bring to the boil for 3-5 min until reduced slightly.

Stir the chopped tomatoes, chicken stock, thyme, and lemon juice into the pan. Season to taste. Pour over the meat then cover and cook in the oven for 2 - 2 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> hrs, or until meat is very tender.
Meanwhile, mix together the garlic, lemon rind and parsley to form the gremolata.
To serve the Osso buco, transfer to warmed serving plates, sprinkle over the gremolata.

title: Osso buco alla milanese
